title: Associate Director, Business Analyst, Dev Centers Solutions
description:
2023 will potentially see Sandoz become a standalone organization! Already a global market leader in Generics and Biosimilar medicine, this is an exciting, once-in-a-career opportunity to set our own path forward as an independent, purpose-driven organization, and as the founders of a new Sandoz, this is a time of immense opportunity for us all, both professionally and personally!

Together we will shape the future of Sandoz are you ready to make a difference?

Why Sandoz?

500 million patients were touched by Sandoz generic and biosimilar medicines in 2021 and while we're proud of this, we know there is more we could do to continue to help pioneer access to medicines for people around the world.

How will we do this? We believe new insights, perspectives and ground-breaking solutions can be found at the intersection of medical science and digital innovation.

Aufgaben

Job Summary/Purpose :

As an Associate Director, Business Analyst, Dev Centers Solutions (d/f/m) you will be... responsible for project delivery and/or operations in the given business area. It will see you partnering with Business Stakeholders and TT Strategic Business Partners for demand analysis, solution proposal/evaluation and project delivery.

Your Key Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Execute technology delivery strategy for business systems, platforms, and processes for a particular Business domain / Function.

‚Ä¢ Partner with senior business stakeholders and TT Strategic Business Partners for demand analysis, solution proposal/evaluation, and funding estimates.

‚Ä¢ Partner with business partners to ensure Technology Service/Solutions Delivery teams deliver products according to strategy with reuse across other areas. Ensure on time, within budget, compliant, secure, and quality delivery of portfolio for responsible function / service area.

‚Ä¢ Ensure services, solutions, platforms, products are fit for purpose and achieve thedesired business value and impact.

‚Ä¢ Run efficient DevOps for platforms, products, or systems ensuring availability andoptimal performance for responsible function / service area.

‚Ä¢ Establish governance structure for projects, operations, etc with right stakeholder representation.

‚Ä¢ Track, report, and deliver against agreed success factors and KPIs for variousstakeholders for responsible function / service area.

‚Ä¢ Follow industry trends and emerging practices to drive agility, speed, efficiency, and effectiveness. Ensure the overall user experience is taken into account when designing deploying new solutions and services.

Profil

Minimum Requirements

What you will bring to the role:

‚Ä¢ University degree or various degrees in business, computer science, information technology discipline or equivalent, MBA optional

‚Ä¢ 5 years+ of industry experience in IT, healthcare, or pharma; expert understanding of technology and methodologies as applied in the respective area

‚Ä¢ Deep knowledge of IT and business processes and experience in validated environments (GxP)

‚Ä¢ Ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders, manage issues, resolve conflicts, and mitigate risks.

‚Ä¢ Networking with key business and IT stakeholders and ability to present to stakeholder groups

‚Ä¢ Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills at team and management levels, with the ability to establish and maintain a high level of trust and confidence

‚Ä¢ Strong internal and/or external influencing skills to achieve the program objectives

‚Ä¢ Analytical, process-oriented with a keen interest to drive continuous improvements

Wir bieten

Diversity & Inclusion / EEO

Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.

Austria only: Minimum annual gross salary ‚Ç¨ 66526,88 (on a full-time basis)

That a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment inspires new ways of working.

We believe our potential can thrive and grow in an unbossed culture underpinned by integrity, curiosity and flexibility. And we can reinvent what's possible, when we collaborate with courage to aggressively and ambitiously tackle the world's toughest medical challenges. Because the greatest risk in life, is the risk of never trying!

Imagine what you could do here at Sandoz!

Join our Sandoz Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to hear more about Sandoz and our career opportunities, join the Network here: (link is external

title: Junior Business Analyst (Remote Internship)
description:
LOCATION: Remote Work

SCHEDULE: Part-time

Are you eager to hone your business analysis skills and kick-start a thriving career in this vibrant field? Would you like to collaborate with a prestigious Management Consulting company in Germany and gain hands-on experience in evaluating business operations? TalentKompass Deutschland is excited to present the perfect opportunity for you!

We are currently offering a beginner-level internship program tailored for individuals passionate about examining business operations and identifying areas for improvement. This internship will equip you with practical experience in business analysis while enhancing your expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, and more.

As an intern with our client's Management Consulting team, you will work closely with accomplished Business Analysts and consultants to collect and analyze data, discern trends and insights, and formulate recommendations for clients. This remote position allows you to work from... the comfort of your own home.

What we're looking for:
‚Ä¢ A genuine interest in understanding business operations
‚Ä¢ Robust analytical skills and the ability to extract meaningful insights from complex data sets
‚Ä¢ Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with a knack for collaborating with team members at all levels
‚Ä¢ Meticulous attention to detail and the ability to work precisely in a fast-paced environment
‚Ä¢ A commitment to learning and growing in the field of business analysis
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with Microsoft Excel or other data analysis tools
‚Ä¢ A basic understanding of statistical analysis and modeling techniques

Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Assist in collecting and analyzing data from various sources
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with consultants to identify trends and insights
‚Ä¢ Develop recommendations to address business challenges
‚Ä¢ Participate in team meetings, contributing ideas and insights
‚Ä¢ Foster a positive team culture and collaborate to achieve team objectives
‚Ä¢ Support the creation of project documentation

If you're prepared to embark on your business analysis career and acquire practical experience, we encourage you to apply for our internship program. Seize this exciting opportunity to learn and grow in the field of business analysis

title: Technical Requirements Engineer / Business Analyst (m/f/x)
description:
At Cloudflight we deliver custom software products to our clients and accompany them throughout their digitalization journey that encompasses everything from discovering their challenges to delivering high-class solutions. Our projects are quite diverse in domains, technology, and setup, so we carefully analyze our customers‚Äô processes and needs to deliver state-of-the-art software that makes their lives easier. That's what we call a digital difference.

We believe in the power of technology as a positive force in society. Because of that, we choose our partners based on our values and high moral standards.

Your daily tasks will include

Ô∏è collaborating with customers, users, and Scrum team members to identify, analyze, and specify requirements for projects

Ô∏è asking targeted questions and proposing alternative solutions to address any professional or technical obstacles that arise during the project

Ô∏è taking the lead in technical grooming and architectural sessions to ensure the... project is on track and meets the requirements

Ô∏è ensuring that all implemented features provide value to the customer and are delivered on time and within budget

Ô∏è conducting acceptance tests to confirm that the project meets the desired quality and functionality

Ô∏è visualizing processes and requirements to facilitate communication and understanding among team members and stakeholders

Ô∏è acting as the primary point of contact between the development team and customers, ensuring clear and effective communication

Ô∏è maintaining and prioritizing the backlog to ensure that the project stays focused and on track

Ô∏è developing and growing the project together with the customer, providing valuable advice and guidance as a trusted advisor

The following will make you succeed in this role

Ô∏è a minimum of 3 years of job-relevant experience, such as in the positions of business analyst, requirements engineer, product owner, or agile project manager in an agile environment with distributed cross-functional teams

Ô∏è analytical thinking, questioning assumptions, and comprehending the requirements of your stakeholders

Ô∏è demonstrating proactive behavior and a high degree of self-initiative

Ô∏è a solid technical background and knowledge of DevOps processes and architecture to contribute to the development and delivery of successful projects

Ô∏è excellent moderation and presentation skills to facilitate productive meetings and presentations with team members and stakeholders

Ô∏è fluency in both English and German

Ô∏è attention to details while also keeping an eye on the big picture to ensure that all project requirements are met and the project stays on track

Ô∏è interest on technical innovations to help drive innovation and continuous improvement within the team and organization

We are an equal opportunity employer. We strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive regardless of their background and circumstances. All applicants receive equal opportunity regardless of age, gender identity or expression, language, disability, ethnicity, national origin, religion, or sexual orientation.

For Austria: The law stipulates that the minimum wage must be specified in job postings. The minimum salary is 48.370 euros/year in the collective agreement. Adequate to your skills, we are willing to pay much more.

We will go through your application and come back with feedback no matter the stage.

Any questions? Contact us at jobs@cloudflight.io

Ô∏è analytical thinking, questioning assumptions, and comprehending the requirements of your stakeholders

Ô∏è demonstrating proactive behavior and a high degree of self-initiative

Ô∏è a solid technical background and knowledge of DevOps processes and architecture to contribute to the development and delivery of successful projects

Ô∏è excellent moderation and presentation skills to facilitate productive meetings and presentations with team members and stakeholders

Ô∏è fluency in both English and German

Ô∏è attention to details while also keeping an eye on the big picture to ensure that all project requirements are met and the project stays on track

Ô∏è interest on technical innovations to help drive innovation and continuous improvement within the team and organization

We are an equal opportunity employer. We strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive regardless of their background and circumstances. All applicants receive equal opportunity regardless of age, gender identity or expression, language, disability, ethnicity, national origin, religion, or sexual orientation.

For Austria: The law stipulates that the minimum wage must be specified in job postings. The minimum salary is 48.370 euros/year in the collective agreement. Adequate to your skills, we are willing to pay much more.

We will go through your application and come back with feedback no matter the stage.

Any questions? Contact us at jobs@cloudflight.io"]}]

title: Business Analyst /m/f/d/ Spare Parts Management - Dynamic Team
description:
We are eager to add an expert Business Analyst (m/f/d) Spare Parts Management to join our knowledgeable team at BRP in Gunskirchen.
Growing your career as a Full Time Business Analyst (m/f/d) Spare Parts Management is an incredible opportunity to develop relevant skills.
If you are strong in critical thinking, emotional intelligence and have the right vision for the job, then apply for the position of Business Analyst (m/f/d) Spare Parts Management at BRP today!

Business Analyst (m/f/d) Spare Parts Management

BRP-Rotax gets the world's most exciting powersports vehicles moving. As part of BRP, with around 20,000 employees worldwide, we are driven by technological progress and sustainable mobility. And what does your heart beat for?

Your new adventure
‚Ä¢ Analysis of spare parts requirements based on historical consumption data
‚Ä¢ Introduction of a tool for forecasting spare parts requirements
‚Ä¢ Continuous development of the planning model to optimize availability and inventory value
‚Ä¢... Data analysis and development of a value-based spare parts pricing strategy
‚Ä¢ Close coordination of the spare parts strategy with the operational business units
‚Ä¢ Development and tracking of key performance indicators to optimize the spare parts business

Your experiences and skills
‚Ä¢ Degree (FH, University) in the field of Supply Chain Management, Data Engineering, Industrial Engineering or equivalent
‚Ä¢ Alternatively, higher technical degree (HTL) with at least 3 years of professional experience, ideally in the area of spare parts sales/logistics
‚Ä¢ Excellent IT skills (SAP, MS-Office with focus on Excel, PowerBI)
‚Ä¢ Very good knowledge of big data analysis and interest in the topics of value chain planning, processes, inventory management and digitalization
‚Ä¢ Good German and very good English skills, both written and spoken
‚Ä¢ High level of social skills and initiative, systematic and goal-oriented way of working with high quality awareness

What we offer

You will receive an exciting position in an international company with many interesting benefits. The minimum salary for this position is EUR 46,346.72 gross/year according to the very attractive collective agreement of the metal industry. An overpayment is possible, depending on your qualifications and experience.

Benefits of working as a Business Analyst (m/f/d) Spare Parts Management in Gunskirchen:

‚óè Excellent benefits
‚óè Continuous Learning Opportunities
‚óè Competitive salary

title: Business Analyst Intern
description:
You will join one of our offices around the world for 10 weeks, usually in the summer, to work in teams and directly with our clients.

In this role, you will help our clients in the private, public, and social sectors solve some their most pressing problems.

You will also work with a range of experts in the firm, from data scientists to researchers to software and app designers.

You‚Äôll work in teams of typically 3 5 consultants, to identify, and oftentimes implement, potential solutions for a specific client problem or challenge.

Together, you will help clients make lasting improvements to their performance and realize their most important goals.

Over the course of each project, you will gather and analyze information, formulate and test hypotheses, and develop and communicate recommendations.

You'll also present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members.

Some examples of the specific work may include interviewing... clients, leading client teams, building financial models, and working with McKinsey subject experts to develop perspectives and insights for the client.

Depending on your area of focus or client needs, you will be asked to travel to your client site.

When you join McKinsey, you are joining a firm whose culture is distinctive and inclusive. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world.

As a business analyst intern, you will receive training and coaching on how to better :
‚Ä¢ Structure ambiguous problems and take action to solve them
‚Ä¢ Synthesize complex information into clear takeaways and recommendations using both qualitative and quantitative methods
‚Ä¢ Work effectively with diverse teams to come up with the best solution and move people and organizations to act
‚Ä¢ Establish trust-based relationships with clients to better serve their organizations
‚Ä¢ Communicate effectively with all audiences, including senior leaders, in a structured manner
‚Ä¢ Develop your leadership style, leveraging your own passions, strengths, and personal values

McKinsey believes in strengths-based development and coaching, and you‚Äôll receive frequent mentoring from colleagues. This will include a senior colleague from your office or practice who will help you grow and achieve your career goals.

Additionally, you will have a professional development manager who manages staffing to help you choose projects based on your priorities as well as the needs of client service teams.

Our business analyst intern program gives a group of undergraduate students and eligible graduate students first-hand experience with consulting at McKinsey.

At the end of your internship, you may receive an offer to join us as a full-time business analyst after the completion of your degree.
‚Ä¢ In your junior year of an undergraduate degree; with an expected graduation dates between December 2024 August 2025
‚Ä¢ Junior year of your undergraduate degree or second year of your non-M.B.A masters
‚Ä¢ Or in your senior / final year of undergraduate studies and planning to enter a one-year master‚Äôs program (in some geographies)
‚Ä¢ Or currently completing your first year in a non-business, 2-year master‚Äôs program and have less than 2 years of work experience
‚Ä¢ Or are in your first year of a two year commitment with Teach for America and have 3 years or fewer of work experience to date
‚Ä¢ Ability to work collaboratively in a team and create an inclusive environment with people at all levels of an organization
‚Ä¢ Capability to drive an independent workstream in the context of a broader team project
‚Ä¢ Comfort with ambiguous, ever-changing situations
‚Ä¢ Ability to break down and solve problems through quantitative thinking and analysis
‚Ä¢ Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and local office language(s

title: IT Business Analyst
description:
Your role in the team
‚Ä¢ Analyze and document business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
‚Ä¢ Identify and assess technical risks and challenges
‚Ä¢ Conduct technical analysis to identify weaknesses in existing systems or processes
‚Ä¢ Create specifications, requirements documents and technical process documentation
‚Ä¢ Work closely with the development team to communicate requirements and support implementation
‚Ä¢ Accompany our departments in the selection of IT solutions as well as the conception and integration into our existing IT landscape
‚Ä¢ Assess new technologies and trends to propose innovative solutions

Technologies and skills
‚Ä¢ JIRA

title: Senior Analyst Business Unit Finance
description: As the world's largest and most broadly based healthcare company, we impact more than a billion lives through the innovation happening at 260 companies located in 60 countries around the world. Teams from Johnson & Johnson's consumer business are improving quality of life by creating digital tools to help people track the health of their skin. Those working in medical devices are 3-D printing artificial joints personalized for each patient, while researchers in pharmaceuticals are using AI to discover lifesaving drugs. We redefine what it means to be a big company in today's world. Who is Janssen? Simply put, we're people; more than 35, 000 working hard to treat, cure, stop and prevent some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time - from autoimmune diseases, hematology, oncology, HIV, mental disorders and heart disease. We believe that challenging something is the best way to change it. So, every day, in more than 150 countries, we bring together cutting-edge science... and the most creative minds in the industry to think differently about how diseases are treated and prevented. We aim not only to innovate but also to empower people with the tools they need to make informed decisions and achieve the best possible results for their health. We are Janssen. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it . Business Unit Finance Senior Analyst Location: Vienna Janssen Austria is recruiting a Senior Financial Analyst to join the Business Unit Finance team based in Vienna, Austria. You will be responsible for supporting one or more therapeutic areas and be an integral part of a $300 million business growing strongly in the next years. This is a great opportunity to support a successful, dynamic and diverse operating company! At Janssen, we are dedicated to addressing and solving some of the most important unmet medical needs of our time in oncology, hematology, immunology, neuroscience, pulmonary hypertension and infectious diseases. Driven by our commitment to patients, we bring innovative products, services and solutions to people throughout the world. Janssen is a pharmaceutical company of Johnson & Johnson (J& J), where we are "Creating a future where disease is a thing of the past." Your Key Responsibilities: To support and drive financial forecasts for each planning cycle for your area of responsibility, ensuring accuracy, credibility, and completeness. To be the finance partner for some of our Business Units, to challenge, advise and support them in their product investments, scenario planning and business cases - having full scope across their sales and spending. To provide insightful analysis to explain deviations in our financial performance. To monitor expenses and resource allocation, where you can provide insights to enable your business leads to make agile decisions across the organization that can drive growth. To manage monthly and quarterly closing cycle, ensuring compliance, accuracy, and timely submissions in close alignment with the Global Services teams and the Finance Accounting Manager. To ensure all business partners have appropriate finance knowledge to enable accurate, timely, complete, and appropriate initiation of financial transactions such as accruals, prepayments, and purchase order goods receipts. To work as a team player across an international environment with the various Finance teams like the transactional and accounting teams in our Prague Global Services hub, the tax team and others. To contribute to an engaging, collaborative, mindful Business Unit Finance team having a Finance Architect mindset - constructive challenging and looking for value creating growth opportunities. To co-create on ad-hoc projects within the local team and/or regional Finance teams. To ensure compliance with the J& J financial, HCC and business conduct procedures and drive accountability throughout the organization. Your Qualifications: University Degree and/or equivalent finance certification Pharmaceutical / commercial finance experience highly desirable Strong business partnering skills; customer oriented and strategic mindset Proactive approach; desire for continuous improvement, simplification, and innovation Excellent interpersonal, communication skills, both written and verbally Ability to independently drive deliverables forward, but work well within a team environment Able to create a positive atmosphere of trust and mutual respect Results oriented with strong prioritization skills and a high sense of urgency Ability to maintain accuracy and be calm under pressure Curious mindset with a desire to learn, innovate and simplify Analytical and able to work with complexity and large amounts of data MS Office high proficiency especially Excel, Analysis for Office, SAP. Fluent English language skills required Fluent German language skills desirable Position requires max. 10% travel (within Europe) For this position we offer a gross annual salary of at least 63.500 EUR (plus applicable variables and benefits). There is a willingness to overpay, depending on professional qualifications and experience. For more than 130 years, diversity, equity & inclusion (DEI) have been part of our cultural fabric at Johnson & Johnson and woven into how we do business every day. Our commitment to respect the dignity and diversity of all is embedded in our Credo. We know that the success of our business depends on having the best talent in a workforce that reflects the diverse markets we serve around the world and an inclusive culture that values different perspectives and life experiences. That is why we in Johnson & Johnson are working to create an inclusive environment where diverse backgrounds, perspectives and experiences are valued and each and every one of our people feels that they belong and can reach their potential. No matter who they are. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Johnson & Johnson means "You Belong
job_highlights: [{'items': ['As the world\'s largest and most broadly based healthcare company, we impact more than a billion lives through the innovation happening at 260 companies located in 60 countries around the world. Teams from Johnson & Johnson\'s consumer business are improving quality of life by creating digital tools to help people track the health of their skin. Those working in medical devices are 3-D printing artificial joints personalized for each patient, while researchers in pharmaceuticals are using AI to discover lifesaving drugs. We redefine what it means to be a big company in today\'s world. Who is Janssen? Simply put, we\'re people; more than 35, 000 working hard to treat, cure, stop and prevent some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time - from autoimmune diseases, hematology, oncology, HIV, mental disorders and heart disease. We believe that challenging something is the best way to change it. So, every day, in more than 150 countries, we bring together cutting-edge science... and the most creative minds in the industry to think differently about how diseases are treated and prevented. We aim not only to innovate but also to empower people with the tools they need to make informed decisions and achieve the best possible results for their health. We are Janssen. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it . Business Unit Finance Senior Analyst Location: Vienna Janssen Austria is recruiting a Senior Financial Analyst to join the Business Unit Finance team based in Vienna, Austria. You will be responsible for supporting one or more therapeutic areas and be an integral part of a $300 million business growing strongly in the next years. This is a great opportunity to support a successful, dynamic and diverse operating company! At Janssen, we are dedicated to addressing and solving some of the most important unmet medical needs of our time in oncology, hematology, immunology, neuroscience, pulmonary hypertension and infectious diseases. Driven by our commitment to patients, we bring innovative products, services and solutions to people throughout the world. Janssen is a pharmaceutical company of Johnson & Johnson (J& J), where we are "Creating a future where disease is a thing of the past." Your Key Responsibilities: To support and drive financial forecasts for each planning cycle for your area of responsibility, ensuring accuracy, credibility, and completeness. To be the finance partner for some of our Business Units, to challenge, advise and support them in their product investments, scenario planning and business cases - having full scope across their sales and spending. To provide insightful analysis to explain deviations in our financial performance. To monitor expenses and resource allocation, where you can provide insights to enable your business leads to make agile decisions across the organization that can drive growth. To manage monthly and quarterly closing cycle, ensuring compliance, accuracy, and timely submissions in close alignment with the Global Services teams and the Finance Accounting Manager. To ensure all business partners have appropriate finance knowledge to enable accurate, timely, complete, and appropriate initiation of financial transactions such as accruals, prepayments, and purchase order goods receipts. To work as a team player across an international environment with the various Finance teams like the transactional and accounting teams in our Prague Global Services hub, the tax team and others. To contribute to an engaging, collaborative, mindful Business Unit Finance team having a Finance Architect mindset - constructive challenging and looking for value creating growth opportunities. To co-create on ad-hoc projects within the local team and/or regional Finance teams. To ensure compliance with the J& J financial, HCC and business conduct procedures and drive accountability throughout the organization. title: IT Business Analyst for our DWH and Group Data Integration (f/m/x)
description:
IT Business Analyst for our DWH and Group Data Integration (f/m/x)

DWH & Group Data Integration is responsible for all innovations and operations in our Enterprise and Group Data Warehouse area, which is the basis for RBI bank steering (Finance, Risk and Regulatory). In our international team intercultural skills and customer orientation are key success factors.

In order to strengthen our team, we are looking for a Business Analyst responsible for managing the business analysis, facilitating and challenging requirements as well as defining test cases to shape the next generation data architecture to fulfill regulatory requirements. You will engage in cross department business analysis initiatives (know-how exchange with subsidiaries) and improve quality assurance of the solutions throughout the entire development process. Support business lines in definition of new IT requirements and change requests are additional responsibilities of that role.

#full-time

(38.5h ... week)

#viennaoffice

(1030 or 1190)

#homeoffice

possible

Your mission at RBI
‚Ä¢ Analyzing and documenting business requirements, changing requests and business processes
‚Ä¢ Structuring and breaking down the backlog with the Product Owner
‚Ä¢ Performing structured system analysis and effort estimations
‚Ä¢ Elaborating detailed mappings for interfaces and facilitating requirements workshops
‚Ä¢ Assisting in troubleshooting of software application issues and incidents
‚Ä¢ Creating the test cases and support system- and user acceptance tests (UAT)

Your core competencies
‚Ä¢ Analytical, result-oriented and structured way of working
‚Ä¢ Experience with Data Warehouse and work experience with SQL
‚Ä¢ Work experience in the finance industry as Business Analyst and Requirements Engineer
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of or interest in the most important bank steering business processes (finance, risk management)
‚Ä¢ Communication skills to act as an interface with different stakeholders
‚Ä¢ Sound skills of English

Nice to have
‚Ä¢ Design backend and front end of BI solutions
‚Ä¢ German

What's in it for you
‚Ä¢ Work Life Balance : f lexible working hours (no core time), extensive hybrid working options / work from home
‚Ä¢ Easy Moving : relocation allowance & work permit support
‚Ä¢ Top-notch Equipment : modern tools & technologies
‚Ä¢ International Spirit : multi-cultural teams, English as company language, team building events
‚Ä¢ Learning & Agile Working : as part of our DNA & culture
‚Ä¢ Canteen : healthy, tasty, and heavily subsidized
‚Ä¢ Saving : with vouchers / discounts from our staffs' council (eg. supermarket)
‚Ä¢ Further Goodies : free public transport pass, salary account & credit card, reduced gym membership, gender-neutral parental leave, bilingual company kindergarten etc.
‚Ä¢ Salary: the offered gross yearly salary starts at 60.000 Euro (basis full-time) including overtime, depending on qualification and experience.

At Raiffeisen Bank International , we are pleased to have more than 17 million customers in Austria and 12 other CEE countries ‚Äì what got us here, are our talented people . From the moment you join RBI, you will notice our commitment to creating a working environment where everyone can thrive. Diversity and inclusion are essential components of our vision and mission and are reflected in our values: collaboration, proactivity, learning and responsibility. Our shared mission is to provide a superior customer experience by tackling new issues such as digitalization and changing needs.

For questions regarding our application process, please feel free to take a look on our website our check out our FAQ .

Follow us on our RBI Account on
LinkedIn

title: International Business Analyst - Retail
description:
Do you have a passion for analysis, reporting and providing insights? This Business Analyst role in our International HQ could be for you!

The International Business Analyst will play an integral role in the International Retail Key Account team by creating, maintaining, and analyzing centralized KPI reports. The International Business Analyst will be responsible for the coordination and communication of the International Retail Key Account performance internally and externally. Also, will be the key user of data platforms relating to sales and budgeting. As a third pillar, the Business Analyst will drive best practice sharing to the wider Sales Off Premise community via our intranet.

title: Business Analyst Counterparty Data Hub Servicing
description:
Position: Business Analyst for Counterparty Data Hub Servicing (all genders)

Working with us means believing in the future; in the great people who are shaping it together every day and in the wide-ranging career paths it opens up. #believeinyourself

Erste Group was founded in 1819 as the first Austrian savings bank and today it is one of the largest banking groups in Central and Eastern Europe (CEE). As an attractive employer, Erste Group offers interesting career opportunities in an international environment.

We in Daily Banking Services want to provide to our clients the best digital experience, which is seamless, convenient, fast and compliant. We aim to digitalize and automatize all our back-office processes to the core, regardless of channels. Customer Data Hub is one of our key systems to provide business support to all Erste Group Banks and meet regulatory requirements. We are currently seeking a talented and experienced Business Analyst to join our team.

In this role, you... will be responsible for analyzing business processes and identifying opportunities for improvement.

You will work closely with other members of the Servicing team to implement changes and enhance efficiency in banking operations.
‚Ä¢ ‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãYou will have a crucial role in designing, documenting, and continuously improving our processes end to end and front to back
‚Ä¢ Work closely with stakeholders, end users, product- and other process owners to define desired outcome of each process improvements or digitalization
‚Ä¢ Responsible to achieve defined targets (KPIs) for process improvements and digitalization
‚Ä¢ Responsible to manage the success and efficiency of processing Units
‚Ä¢ Actively collect customer feedback to drive the re-design and enhancement of end-to-end processes
‚Ä¢ Identify data quality issues and work with the appropriate teams to resolve them
‚Ä¢ Act as competency for complex inquiries towards our stakeholders from stakeholders, business and service providers
‚Ä¢ ‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãAt least five years background in the banking industry, in process improvement or operations, with strong focus on corporate customers
‚Ä¢ Exceptional knowledge and understanding of corporate customer needs, risk and compliance
‚Ä¢ Customer-oriented and excellent communication skills; making it easy for you to interact with people in an intercultural and diverse environment
‚Ä¢ You're self-accountable and solution-oriented, with a hands-on mindset, a positive, entrepreneurial, and agile spirit, and the willingness to accept challenges
‚Ä¢ Experience with data analysis tools such as SQL or Tableau preferred
‚Ä¢ If you're fluent in English and German and want to be part of a dynamic and passionate team that's dedicated to improving the customer experience, we encourage you to apply now. Let's make a difference together
‚Ä¢ We are a team who lives and breathes innovation and digital transformation and likes to push boundaries to the next level.
‚Ä¢ We are open minded, supportive and always ready to go the extra mile for our customers
‚Ä¢ We take care of your personal wellbeing, career development, and we actively support your educational needs
‚Ä¢ Discover and enjoy the benefits of Erste Group
‚Ä¢ The minimum wage for this full-time position in accordance with the collective agreement with complete fulfillment of the functional profile is EUR 44.567,

-- gross per year. But this is just a formality - we would be happy to talk about your actual salary in person!
‚Ä¢ We offer our employees the opportunity to divide their hours between working from home and at the office.
‚Ä¢ Erste Group considers the diversity of its employees as key to innovation and success. As employer we are proud to offer everyone equal chances, irrespective of age, skin colour, religious belief, gender, sexual orientation or origin

title: Senior Business Analyst (m/w/d)
description:
Company Description

Jobs for Humanity is dedicated to building an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. Therefore, we have dedicated this job posting to individuals coming from the following communities: Refugee, Neurodivergent, Single Parent, Blind or Low Vision, Deaf of Hard of Hearing Black, Hispanic, Asian, Military Veterans, the Elderly, the LGBTQ, and Justice Impacted individuals. If you identify with any of the following communities do not hesitate to register.

Company Name: FIS Global

Job Description

Position Type :
Full time

Type Of Hire :
Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)

Education Desired :
Bachelor of Computer Science

Travel Percentage :
5 - 10%

The world of finance moves fast. At FIS, we‚Äôre faster. Our teams are empowered to learn, grow, and make an impact‚Äìin their careers and communities. We deliver innovation that advances the way the world pays, banks and invests. If you want to grow personally and professionally, we‚Äôd like to know: Are you... FIS?

We are currently looking for a Senior Business Analyst (m/w/d) to support the FIS Banking team in Germany. Ideally located in Munich or Graz (Austria).

About the team

The Design and Architecture Team sits within the Client Delivery organisation and is responsible for architecting and designing technical solutions. The Team is involved in a wide range of activities that include solutioning Client customisations and enhancements, Client implementations, system-specific projects that may involve development or enhancement of internal applications, technology integration and/or infrastructure environment build-out. Another important aspect of the Team‚Äôs work is supporting pre-sales initiatives providing input to prospect RFI and RFPs.

What you will be doing
‚Ä¢ Use expertise in specific business processes to provide technical guidance to Clients and FIS teams concerning business implications of applications of various systems.
‚Ä¢ Work on technology business consulting activities to meet specific Client requirements.
‚Ä¢ Serve as liaison between end-users and consultants during consulting projects.
‚Ä¢ Create detailed specifications from which programs will be written.
‚Ä¢ Support QA teams in writing test plans and test cases to ensure enhancements made to applications meet client needs and application integrity is maintained.
‚Ä¢ Support testing such as system, integration, readiness and acceptance tests, ensuring client needs will be met.
‚Ä¢ Work at client sites from time to time requiring some travel.

What you bring:
‚Ä¢ Previous experience working in a Business Consultant role at a senior level.
‚Ä¢ Detailed knowledge of some or all of the following products in the German market: loans, savings and/or payments.
‚Ä¢ Experience working in a technology or financial services organization and preferably have worked in a vendor/client capacity.
‚Ä¢ Fluent command of English and German

What we offer you:

At FIS, you can learn, grow and make an impact in your career. Our benefits include:
‚Ä¢ A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility
‚Ä¢ The chance to work on challenging, relevant issues in financial services & technology
‚Ä¢ Varied and challenging work to help you grow your technical and functional skillset
‚Ä¢ A modern, international work environment and a dedicated and motivated team

#LI-PL1

Privacy Statement

FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.

Sourcing Model

Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

title: Wirtschaftsinformatiker/in it-anforderungsmanager/in
description:
Digitalisierung, IT-Projektmanagement, IT-Architektur, IT, SAP S/4 HANA, SAP Business Analyst (m/f/d) View job here Business analyst
‚Ä¢ (m/f/i) - full-time, permanent Full-time ProPotsdam, Pappelallee 4, 14469 Potsdam, Germany With professional experience 27.06.23 ProPotsdam GmbH is the largest housing company in the state capital Potsdam and a leading service provider in the areas of urban redevelopment, urban development, housing construction and housing welfare.
With a portfolio of over 17,800 rental apartments, it is also the largest housing provider in the Potsdam housing market.
Are you interested in helping our company drive the digitalization of our business processes and do you always like to solve new problems? You will fit in with us if you have both a technical affinity but also an eye for technical and business optimization potential and would like to implement new digitization requirements together with the specialist departments and the IT team.
Don't miss this... opportunity to apply your skills and passion in an exciting environment.
Awaiting you is a proactive team with strong communication skills that you can rely on, as well as a modern S/4 HANA landscape with apps and portals and Microsoft M365 environment.
ProPotsdam GmbH is looking for a
‚Ä¢ n as soon as possible.
Business Analyst
‚Ä¢ (m/f/i) - full-time, permanent Your tasks:
Receive, review and evaluate new requirements, taking into account implementation time, costs, ongoing projects, existing standards and IT architecture, as well as IT security and compliance requirements.
Review solution approaches and design solution scope to outline possible IT solutions with it.
Manage and control the central requirements management as a link between business department and IT team and IT project management.
Prepare a project outline that outlines the business and IT framework, includes a price and capacity estimate, makes cost-benefit considerations and takes into account the estimated support needs and ongoing support.
Create concepts and guidelines for the implementation of IT solutions, as well as perform process modeling in collaboration with stakeholders.
Handover to the project management and participation in the implementation.
Determine the plan values for IT requirements from the company to the annual economic planning and responsibility of these budgets according to the agreed implementation goals.
Other comparable tasks as well as special tasks as specified by the supervisor.
Job Requirements:
Completed studies in business informatics or comparable studies.
Expertise in the analysis and evaluation of business requirements from the areas of construction and project controlling and ordering processes (knowledge of SAP modules PS, PM, MM).
Experience in requirements/demand management and consulting and evaluation of new digitization projects.
Strong understanding of business processes and a clear focus on the needs of the business, combined with in-depth IT knowledge and methodological expertise Understanding of technology and flexibility in familiarizing with new systems, applications, structures and processes.
Strong communication skills, ability to work in a team as well as a high analytical, structured and solution-oriented way of working We offer, among other things:
We give you the working environment so that you can shape life in Potsdam with their commitment and projects:
With flexible working hours and the option of mobile working.
with a structured onboarding process and regular feedback meetings, we ensure a successful integration into our company with a long-term investment in our employees
‚Ä¢ innen - for this reason we promote the personal and professional development of our employees
‚Ä¢ innen with an attractive workplace in a municipal company established for over 30 years in Potsdam.
You can get an overview of our benefits here:
MA-Benefits-Booklet_RZ_Web.pdf (propotsdam.de) What you can expect from us! In the ProPotsdam group of companies, you can expect many interesting and varied tasks as well as a large, friendly team in a modern and family-friendly working environment.
ProPotsdam is one of the best employers in the capital region Berlin-Brandenburg and has been awarded in the competition Great Place to Work¬Æ "Best Employers in Berlin-Brandenburg 2022".
You too can become part of the ProPotsdam team! We look forward to tackling and implementing the most diverse tasks for our state capital Potsdam together with you.
Have we piqued your interest? Then apply online now via the application button.
To do this, please upload your complete application documents.
Applications will only be accepted via the application form.
Contact:
Cassie Opitz (0331-6206 229).
Imprint | Privacy Policy Powered by softgarden

title: Business Analyst (m/f/d) Spare Parts Management
description:
Business Analyst (m/f/d) Spare Parts Management

BRP-Rotax gets the world's most exciting powersports vehicles moving. As part of BRP, with around 20,000 employees worldwide, we are driven by technological progress and sustainable mobility. And what does your heart beat for?

Your new adventure
‚Ä¢ Analysis of spare parts requirements based on historical consumption data
‚Ä¢ Introduction of a tool for forecasting spare parts requirements
‚Ä¢ Continuous development of the planning model to optimize availability and inventory value
‚Ä¢ Data analysis and development of a value-based spare parts pricing strategy
‚Ä¢ Close coordination of the spare parts strategy with the operational business units
‚Ä¢ Development and tracking of key performance indicators to optimize the spare parts business

Your experiences and skills
‚Ä¢ Degree (FH, University) in the field of Supply Chain Management, Data Engineering, Industrial Engineering or equivalent
‚Ä¢ Alternatively, higher technical degree (HTL) with at least... 3 years of professional experience, ideally in the area of spare parts sales/logistics
‚Ä¢ Excellent IT skills (SAP, MS-Office with focus on Excel, PowerBI)
‚Ä¢ Very good knowledge of big data analysis and interest in the topics of value chain planning, processes, inventory management and digitalization
‚Ä¢ Good German and very good English skills, both written and spoken
‚Ä¢ High level of social skills and initiative, systematic and goal-oriented way of working with high quality awareness

What we offer

You will receive an exciting position in an international company with many interesting benefits. The minimum salary for this position is EUR 46,346.72 gross/year according to the very attractive collective agreement of the metal industry. An overpayment is possible, depending on your qualifications and experience

title: ERP Finance Business Analyst - Oracle JDE
description: ERP Finance Business Analyst - JD Edwards An International company is implementing Oracle JDE to their International entities. They are looking for an experienced JDE Finance Business Analyst or Functional Consultant to deliver Finance Business Analysis and Gap-Fit the Template solution to existing Finance and Accounting Processes. Support the deployment of the solution across the global business * Business Analysis, Process Mapping, Gap-Fit for Financials, GL, AP, AR and Accounting * Requirements gathering for Finance / Accounting /Controlling processes * Gap-fit analysis between existing Finance solution and JDE Template * Support JD Edwards Finance System localisations and changes based on local requirements * Support end-to-end solution design and rollout: System Testing, UAT and Training for end-users across business functions * Change management Your profile * ERP Functional Consultant or Finance Business Analyst with Oracle JDE knowledge * Strong Functional knowledge of Finance... processes; Accounting / Controlling: GL, AP, AR, Record-to-Report (R2R) * Finance Business Analysis and Gap-Fit for JD Edwards Finance * Experience delivering End User Testing, Training and Change for ERP implemenatations * Fluent German Type: Freelance Consultant / Contractor Duration: 6-12 months initially Location: Remote, Europe, with occasional travel in DACH regions Apply online, via LinkedIn or email your CV to Jamie@systemsaccountants.com SystemsAccountants is a specialist Headhunter in the area of ERP, EPM and Business Intelligence across Business Sectors. Follow #systemsaccountants on Linkedin! For more information on this and related ERP and Digital Finance career opportunities, or to understand how we can support you, please contact Jamie Colwell at SystemsAccountants: jamie@systemsaccountants.com

title: Business Analyst (m/w/d)
description:
METRO ist ein internationaler Lebensmittelgro√üh√§ndler mit einem vielf√§ltigen Food- und Non-Food Sortiment, der bereits seit 50 Jahren in √ñsterreich vertreten ist. Wir arbeiten weltweit f√ºr den Erfolg von unabh√§ngigen Unternehmen. Wir arbeiten f√ºr √ºber 500.000 Selbstst√§ndige √∂sterreichweit. Wir arbeiten f√ºr Umsetzer, Vision√§re, Mutige, Abenteurer, jene die an sich glauben und ihre Tr√§ume verwirklichen. Wir arbeiten f√ºr unsere Kunden!

Zur Verst√§rkung unseres Business Intelligence Teams im Head Office in V√∂sendorf suchen wir einen

Business Analyst (m/w/d)
Vollzeit 38,5 Wochenstunden, ab sofort

Aufgaben

Ihre Aufgaben:
‚Ä¢ Sie erg√§nzen unser BI Team und arbeiten aktiv an allen Analysen mit
‚Ä¢ Sie sind verantwortlich f√ºr die Aufbereitung und den Versand regul√§rer Reportings
‚Ä¢ Sie unterst√ºtzen operativ bei diversen Projekten
‚Ä¢ Sie sind f√ºr ad hoc Analysen verantwortlich und unterst√ºtzen bei der Aufbereitung von Powerpoint-Pr√§sentationen f√ºr den Einkauf sowie die Gesch√§ftsf√ºhrung
‚Ä¢ Sie... analysieren Anwenderanforderungen zur Erstellung von Reports f√ºr unser Team
‚Ä¢ Sie entwickeln und implementieren innovative Dashboards in unserem Reporting Tool

Profil

Ihre Qualifikationen:
‚Ä¢ Sie haben eine abgeschlossene kaufm√§nnische oder technische Ausbildung (z.B. Universit√§t, FH, HTL, HAK)
‚Ä¢ Sie haben Berufserfahrung in Analyse- oder Controlling Abteilungen
‚Ä¢ Zahlenaffinit√§t sowie analytisches Denkverm√∂gen
‚Ä¢ Sie verf√ºgen √ºber starke Excel-Kenntnisse und idealerweise haben Sie bereits mit Analysesoftware (wie z.B. MicroStrategy) gearbeitet
‚Ä¢ Sie bringen gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse mit, um innerhalb des Konzerns zu kommunizieren
‚Ä¢ Sie sind ein Teamplayer, arbeiten in Ihrem Aufgabengebiet aber selbstst√§ndig
‚Ä¢ Sie arbeiten sich rasch in neue Themenstellungen und komplexe Aufgaben ein und bewahren auch in stressigen Situationen den √úberblick

Wir bieten

Was wir bieten:
‚Ä¢ Die Vorteile eines Gro√üunternehmens mit ansprechenden Sozialleistungen wie Mitarbeiterrabatte, gratis Parkplatz und Verg√ºnstigungen in unserem Betriebsrestaurant
‚Ä¢ Flexible Arbeitszeiten im Rahmen unseres Gleitzeitmodells sowie Home Office M√∂glichkeit
‚Ä¢ Aus- und Weiterbildungsm√∂glichkeiten sowie individuelle Entwicklungsm√∂glichkeiten bei METRO

Ihr Gehaltspaket:

Es ist uns wichtig, dass sich Ihr Gehalt an Ihren Qualifikationen und Erfahrungen orientiert. Gerne kl√§ren wir das gemeinsam im pers√∂nlichen Gespr√§ch. Der guten Ordnung halber geben wir an, dass f√ºr diese Position ein Mindestgehalt von EUR 40.000,- brutto pro Jahr auf Vollzeitbasis gilt.

Haben wir Ihr Interesse an dieser Stelle geweckt? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung.
Ihr Kontakt bei Fragen: Frau Lucia Reiter

title: Test Analyst for George (all genders)
description:
Ôªø Test Analyst for George (all genders)
Vienna, Wien, Austria

Banking has a name. And we create it.

For more than 9 million customers across Europe, George stands for a digital banking experience that combines design and technology on an open platform. At the George Labs, we strive for everyone. We achieve this by empowering people to understand, manage and, last but not least, enjoy one of their most personal things: their money.

Join us in our agile environment and make banking simple, intelligent and personal again!

We understand your pain. QA Engineers and Testers do not get the respect they deserve! But with us, your technical knowledge and testing abilities are as much valued as the cool designs that comes out of the creative team. You will work closely with our developers along the full user story, working together on the same code towards the same goal of providing market-ready software at the end of each Sprint. You will create well-structured and well-considered test... cases, executing automation scripts using open source tools, all while keeping the nasty bugs away.
What you‚Äôll bring with you
‚Ä¢ A toolkit full of software development and QA experience
‚Ä¢ Experience with analyzing application logs
‚Ä¢ Experience with checking databases for the correct state
‚Ä¢ Patience for problem-solving and thinking out of the box
‚Ä¢ Curiosity about object-oriented programming (Kotlin or Java preferred)
‚Ä¢ The ability to write clean and readable code with documentation
‚Ä¢ Experience with backend testing (both manual and automated)
‚Ä¢ Deep insight of software QA methodologies
‚Ä¢ A natural confidence with your communication skills, while being fluent in English
‚Ä¢ Living the agile mindset, testing in a scrum team while collaborating with developers and business analysts.

You will impress us by
‚Ä¢ Being able to independently solve problems and make decisions about testing results
‚Ä¢ Feeling comfortable with talking to stakeholders and different business teams
‚Ä¢ Confidently wearing T-shirts with the slogan ‚ÄòTDD & BDD are not diseases!‚Äô
‚Ä¢ Being proactive and self-motivated without the ego to go with it
‚Ä¢ Having the ability to see the big picture and have a strong quality awareness
‚Ä¢ Knowing that variety, changing trends, and constantly upgrading your skills is better than any alternative

Why you will like us
‚Ä¢ We‚Äôre a team of experienced testers who love to exchange ideas and push the boundaries
‚Ä¢ We provide everything you need to work (e.g., MacBook Pro, mobile device, licenses) and lots of additional benefits
‚Ä¢ We are open minded, and always keen to stand up and go the extra mile for the correct solution
‚Ä¢ New Work is not just another buzz word to us. We proactively adapt to the ever-changing work environment of today
‚Ä¢ We guarantee a competitive and performance-related salary, dependent on your professional and personal qualifications. We are obliged by law to quote the minimum wage of EUR 48.370,-- gross per year for this position, in accordance with the respective collective agreement.

If you‚Äôve got this far It seems we have your interest. If you think you are a good fit for this position, please get in touch with us, we‚Äôd love to catch up.

Apply for this Job

title: Business Process Analyst
description:
We are looking for a Business Process Analysis and Improvement specialist to strengthen our Process Excellence team at the global Red Bull headquarters in Salzburg, Austria.

In this position, you'll support the business as process analysis expert to drive process optimization utilizing process data analyses based on state-of-the-art process mining technologies. You'll collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand the business requirements, combine data from different source systems, define data requirements, analyze information and identify and drive process improvements. You'll act as a coach for the business regarding improvement of the business processes.

You'll collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand the business requirements, combine data from different source systems, define data requirements, analyze information and identify and drive process improvements. title: Technical Analyst (all genders)
description:
Ôªø

Make a difference in the financial life of millions of people: At Erste Digital you are co-creating the digital future, in which better financial health is possible. #believeinyourself
Technical Analyst (all genders)

Location:
Vienna

Working-Hours:
Full-time

Occupation Area:
IT

Company:
Erste Digital

The future of banking is digital, and IT is the key to this change. Erste Digital is the digital enabler that drives innovative IT solutions for Erste Group, the leading banking group in CEE. Our service involves ‚Äúrun the bank‚Äù as well as ‚Äúchange the bank‚Äù activities. Our more than 2,000 IT experts and enthusiasts deliver best-in-class IT solutions and services to all Erste Group entities and by this directly to Erste Group‚Äôs more than 16 million customers. Are you ready to work for one of the most innovative and largest IT companies in the CEE region? Then hit the ‚Äúapply now‚Äù button.

Now is an amazing opportunity to join Erste Digital in its mission to transform the banking... services in Austria and eastern European countries. We count over 6 million customers in Austria and over hundreds of Bank Products. We strive for building a digital bank that requires robust, fast, and stable processing systems in the background. We are looking for someone who is smart, savvy, and seriously good at translating business requirements into technical concepts e.g. by designing great REST APIs and business workflows. You are organized, a natural communicator, and can bring people together to create shared understanding. Consistency and clarity are important for you and you strive to always get better in it.
In this role, you will:
‚Ä¢ support the team in the analysis of technical requirements in cooperation with business partners.
‚Ä¢ define technical software requirement specifications and review functional designs regarding solution architecture, future business needs and operations.
‚Ä¢ create a common understanding of business requirements, design solutions that follow our best practices, with always keeping a clear end-customer focus in mind
‚Ä¢ work in a great team and with a diverse group of people such as other software engineers, data analysts, and decision-makers (e. g. product owners), to build solutions and gain novel insights.
‚Ä¢ work with tools like Jira for ticket management and actively contribute to Scrum or Kanban meetings and retrospectives.

What should you bring with you:
‚Ä¢ strong analytical thinking and a technical background, ideally with a completed technical degree.
‚Ä¢ experience in requirements engineering and with state-of-the-art technologies (Microservices, PaaS, SOA, APIs, ‚Ä¶) and agile software delivery methods.
‚Ä¢ proven track-record working in the IT or similar area.
‚Ä¢ good communication skills in English and/or German (verbal and written).

Our Offer
‚Ä¢ Possibility to benefit and learn from our international, talented and passionate community at Erste
‚Ä¢ Great learning curve through ownership and creative freedom
‚Ä¢ Interest groups and clubs: Take part in discussions and get involved in projects. Numerous interest groups invite you to engage with a topic
‚Ä¢ Good food: Healthy nutrition and good food are important for our quality of life. With seven restaurants and cafeterias, there‚Äôs something to suit every taste on the Erste Campus
‚Ä¢ Health Centre ‚Äì The Erste Campus operates a fully equipped health center that offers all employees a high standard of medical services during working hours
‚Ä¢ New way of work: With our flexible working hours model we want to make your life less complicated. Combing the best of both worlds, remote and company time
‚Ä¢ Employee benefits ‚Äì Benefit from special conditions for financial services and insurances, supermarkets, clothing stores and many more
‚Ä¢ Employee Referral Program ‚Äì Become a talent scout for career opportunities in IT. We are rewarding every successful referral for Erste Digital
‚Ä¢ Language courses for German & English ‚Äì Learning a new language unites. We support you with appropriate language courses where you participate together with your colleagues
‚Ä¢ Work-Life-Balance ‚Äì Home office, paternity leave, sabbatical, sports courses -‚Äì we support you in balancing work, family and leisure time
‚Ä¢ The minimum wage for this full-time position in accordance with the collective agreement with complete fulfillment of the functional profile is EUR 48.370,-- gross per year. But this is just a formality - we would be happy to talk about your actual salary in person!
‚Ä¢ Erste Digital considers the diversity of its employees as key to innovation and success. As employer we are proud to offer everyone equal chances, irrespective of age, skin colour, religious belief, gender, sexual orientation or origin

Apply online

Follow us

title: Group Business Treasury Analyst (m/f/d)
description:
What if energy supply could be sustainable, affordable, and reliable at the same time? With its powerful Jenbacher and Waukesha gas engines, INNIO brings energy solutions for today‚Äîand tomorrow, in more than 100 countries, improving the quality of life for countless people. Do you want to make a difference with your work? For our Finance & Treasury Department we're searching for a Group Business Treasury Analyst (m/f/d). Join our team now!

At INNIO we offer you:
‚Ä¢ An innovative and international working environment
‚Ä¢ Flexible working time model (depending on position and role)
‚Ä¢ Health We Care Program ‚Äì including company sport activities
‚Ä¢ Moving cost support for new employees in accordance with policy
‚Ä¢ Good connections to public transport ‚Äì station in direct proximity
‚Ä¢ Transportation cost support in accordance with policy
‚Ä¢ One of the best canteens in the area with healthy and various meals
‚Ä¢ Attractive location in the heart of the alps which provides various outdoor sport and... other leisure possibilities
Your Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Central contact for banks and investors
‚Ä¢ Management of external and internal financing
‚Ä¢ Group-wide Cash and liquidity management:
‚Ä¢ Own and further development of a daily financial status
‚Ä¢ Own and further development of a rolling 13-week cash flow forecast
‚Ä¢ Execution of the daily disposition
‚Ä¢ Observing interest rates / optimizing borrowing and investment
‚Ä¢ Support with Administrative tasks (e.g. KYC)
‚Ä¢ Independent support of the subsidiaries in all questions of cash and liquidity management
‚Ä¢ FX observation and Management
‚Ä¢ Treasury Reporting and Controlling
‚Ä¢ Maintenance and further development of the Group Treasury Management System from Coupa/Bellin
‚Ä¢ Close and independent cooperation with Accounting, Controlling and other relevant departments
‚Ä¢ Support with direct reporting to the top management and the owners of the company
‚Ä¢ Special projects and ad-hoc analysis in the area of Group Treasury
Your Profile:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor or Master degree in Economics, Finance & Controlling with additional work experience or apprenticeship in a bank (e.g. bank specific higher education, bank clerk etc.)
‚Ä¢ Proven experience in the areas of Treasury / Controlling / Accounting of an international enterprise
‚Ä¢ Ideally first work experience in an international industrial company
‚Ä¢ Very good MS-Office Skills, experience with the usual Treasury Management software systems
‚Ä¢ Strong teamwork, cooperation capability, flexibility, strong commitment and resilience
‚Ä¢ Fluency in English, German beneficial
‚Ä¢ A valid work permit for Austria is a prerequisite for this position (Non-EU citizens: please attach the work permit to the application)
At INNIO, we offer a competitive salary package which is far above the requirements of the metal collective agreement in Austria. We highly value your individual qualifications and experience. As part of our recruiting process, we engage in open dialogue with you to discuss the details and ensure the best possible fit

title: Business Analyst
company_name: Penrith District Rugby League Football Club
description:
Penrith District Rugby League Football Club has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Business Analyst to join its energetic team. Built on a foundation of hard work and determination, Panthers strives to serve its community and deliver excellence on and off the field. As the back-to-back NRL premiers, this is a unique opportunity to join one of Australia‚Äôs leading sporting clubs.

Within this role you will help facilitate and drive business transformation across our organisation and play a key role in implementing strategic initiatives to improve processes, increase effectiveness with innovative solutions to support future growth.

Your main duties and responsibilities will include:
‚Ä¢ Reviewing existing operations, processes and procedures to recommend productivity or cost saving initiatives
‚Ä¢ Preparing business cases to support new investment, strategic and other business decisions
‚Ä¢ Communicating results and recommendations to management and other stakeholders to improve the... overall business.
‚Ä¢ Use process reengineering to improve current systems usage to drive efficiency and suggest system upgrades
‚Ä¢ Building dashboards and visualisations for internal reporting across multiple departments.
‚Ä¢ Creation of tools to facilitate self-service reporting.
‚Ä¢ Administration of club data sets including (but not limited to) membership sales and attendance, partnership campaigns and merchandise sales.
‚Ä¢ Collation and cleansing of externally and internally sourced data sets
‚Ä¢ Reporting and Analysis of data sets such as survey results, consumer and sales data
‚Ä¢ Assist with communication journeys for new data
‚Ä¢ Assist with bi-annual corporate partner reviews
‚Ä¢ Build merchandise and membership profiles to drive targeted communication
‚Ä¢ Ensure club database contacts are active and are receiving communication
‚Ä¢ Work with the Leagues Club Senior Business Analysis when needed and be trained as their backup
‚Ä¢ Governance analysis

Skills and attributes
‚Ä¢ Strong analytical background
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) with the ability to build relationships across multiple teams and management levels
‚Ä¢ Solutions orientated team member who can work in a rapidly evolving and dynamic team environment
‚Ä¢ Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple competing priorities
‚Ä¢ Ability to multi task
‚Ä¢ Attention to detail
‚Ä¢ Intermediate/Advanced Excel skills
‚Ä¢ Experience in Qlikview, Power BI, Tableau (preferred)
‚Ä¢ 3 to 5 years experience
‚Ä¢ Business Degree

title: Associate Director, Business Analyst, Dev Centers Solutions
description:
2023 will potentially see Sandoz become a standalone organization! Already a global market leader in Generics and Biosimilar medicine, this is an exciting, once-in-a-career opportunity to set our own path forward as an independent, purpose-driven organization, and as the founders of a new Sandoz, this is a time of immense opportunity for us all, both professionally and personally!

Together we will shape the future of Sandoz‚Ä¶ are you ready to make a difference?

Job Summary/Purpose :

As an Associate Director, Business Analyst, Dev Centers Solutions (d/f/m) you will be responsible for project delivery and/or operations in the given business area. It will see you partnering with Business Stakeholders and TT Strategic Business Partners for demand analysis, solution proposal/evaluation and project delivery.

Your Key Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Execute technology delivery strategy for business systems, platforms, and processes for a particular Business domain / Function.
‚Ä¢ Partner with senior... business stakeholders and TT Strategic Business Partners for demand analysis, solution proposal/evaluation, and funding estimates.
‚Ä¢ Partner with business partners to ensure Technology Service/Solutions Delivery teams deliver products according to strategy with reuse across other areas. Ensure on time, within budget, compliant, secure, and quality delivery of portfolio for responsible function / service area.
‚Ä¢ Ensure services, solutions, platforms, products are fit for purpose and achieve thedesired business value and impact.
‚Ä¢ Run efficient DevOps for platforms, products, or systems ensuring availability andoptimal performance for responsible function / service area.
‚Ä¢ Establish governance structure for projects, operations, etc with right stakeholder representation.
‚Ä¢ Track, report, and deliver against agreed success factors and KPIs for variousstakeholders for responsible function / service area.
‚Ä¢ Follow industry trends and emerging practices to drive agility, speed, efficiency, and effectiveness. Ensure the overall user experience is taken into account when designing deploying new solutions and services.

Diversity & Inclusion / EEO

Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.

What you will bring to the role:
‚Ä¢ University degree or various degrees in business, computer science, information technology discipline or equivalent, MBA optional
‚Ä¢ 5 years+ of industry experience in IT, healthcare, or pharma; expert understanding of technology and methodologies as applied in the respective area
‚Ä¢ Deep knowledge of IT and business processes and experience in validated environments (GxP)
‚Ä¢ Ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders, manage issues, resolve conflicts, and mitigate risks.
‚Ä¢ Networking with key business and IT stakeholders and ability to present to stakeholder groups
‚Ä¢ Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills at team and management levels, with the ability to establish and maintain a high level of trust and confidence
‚Ä¢ Strong internal and/or external influencing skills to achieve the program objectives
‚Ä¢ Analytical, process-oriented with a keen interest to drive continuous improvements

Austria only: Minimum annual gross salary ‚Ç¨ 66526,88 (on a full-time basis)

#ORBIT

Why Sandoz?
500 million patients were touched by Sandoz generic and biosimilar medicines in 2021 and while we‚Äôre proud of this, we know there is more we could do to continue to help pioneer access to medicines for people around the world.
How will we do this? We believe new insights, perspectives and ground-breaking solutions can be found at the intersection of medical science and digital innovation. That a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment inspires new ways of working.
We believe our potential can thrive and grow in an unbossed culture underpinned by integrity, curiosity and flexibility. And we can reinvent what's possible, when we collaborate with courage to aggressively and ambitiously tackle the world‚Äôs toughest medical challenges. Because the greatest risk in life, is the risk of never trying!

Imagine what you could do here at Sandoz!

Join our Sandoz Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to hear more about Sandoz and our career opportunities, join the Network here

title: International Business Analyst - Convenience
description:
Company Description

The International Business Analyst will play a hands-on role in developing market winning strategies and initiatives to accelerate the Red Bull business.

If you are someone that relentlessly pursues all available sources, data, research, and communication to continually make informed proposals on areas of opportunity for the business this role might be for you!

Job Description

QUANTITATIVE

In this role you will be responsible for establishing knowledge and expertise on all current data sources ‚Äì IRi/Nielsen sell-out, BI depletions and profitability, audit data, etc while you also evaluate when/where new sources are available and/or necessary. You'll build reports, dashboards, insights decks on a regular basis to continually be up to date on the latest industry trends as well as uncover, understand, and communicate the most important information to support insights, share with markets, and/or work with customers. You'll also be leading your own projects while... creates a deep understanding on core business principles/initiatives by advocating and leading research.

QUALITATIVE

This role involves being cross-functional in thought and process, collaborating with other departments to gain a comprehensive understanding of the brand's vision. It requires leading conversations with markets to stay informed about the local business landscape beyond relying solely on data. Additionally, meeting with customers, comprehending their objectives, and identifying opportunities to further support local teams is crucial. In this role you'll be responsible for presenting in various settings such as internal calls, customer meetings, and formal gatherings, serving as the subject matter expert on trends, data, and insights. Active listening skills are necessary to anticipate and proactively address customer needs or market demands. Problem-solving abilities based on logical and pragmatic thinking are required during negotiations. Lastly, finding effective ways to share information with teams, whether through Sharepoint or one-on-one calls, is an essential aspect of the role.

Qualifications

University Degree

Excellent English Skills

High level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint

Previous Sales experience preferred

Learner, self-motivated and able to work independently

A team player with great integrity

Strong analytical skills using internal and external data sources (i.e. Nielsen, Canadean, etc)

Additional Information

Due to legal reasons, we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary according to the collective agreement for this position, which is ‚Ç¨ 2.041 gross per month. However, our attractive compensation package is based on market-oriented salaries and is therefore significantly above the stated minimum salary.

As an employer, we value diversity and support people in developing their potential and strengths, realizing their ideas and seizing opportunities. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, skin colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation or origin

title: Support Analyst Business Applications (m/f/d)
description:
Support Analyst Business Applications (m/f/d)

BRP-Rotax gets the world's most exciting powersports vehicles moving. As part of BRP, with around 20,000 employees worldwide, we are driven by technological progress and sustainable mobility. And what does your heart beat for?

Your new adventure

As a Support Analyst Business Applications you will be responsible and active for all technical aspects of the software lifecycle (conception, customizing, development, testing, documentation and 3rd level support) in a modern system landscape and in an international team.
‚Ä¢ Together with the local and global IT team, you will drive the further development of existing and new applications.
‚Ä¢ You will be the interface to several specialists, from the IT and other departments (virtually and personally: we offer flexible home office!).
‚Ä¢ You will think outside the box and work closely with the internal business analyst team and translate business requirements into a functional design.
‚Ä¢ We are a... company with a wide range of production and with the full innovation lifecycle onsite: from R&D over industrialization and mechanical manufacturing as well as fully automated assembly.
‚Ä¢ Innovation: no matter if new products (e.g. electric motors) or the processes and tools that lead to it!

Your experiences and skills
‚Ä¢ Completed studies (FH, university) in the fields of information technology or applied computer science
‚Ä¢ At least 3 years of professional experience in a comparable IT role and industry
‚Ä¢ Broad business application background (portals, archiving, document management, workflow management)
‚Ä¢ Basic knowledge of IT infrastructure and system architecture
‚Ä¢ Experience with ITIL standards
‚Ä¢ Good German and English language skills
‚Ä¢ Problem-solving team player with a high level of personal responsibility, commitment and analytical thinking

We offer
You will receive an exciting position in an international company with many interesting benefits. The minimum salary for this position is ‚Ç¨ 53.068,12 EUR gross/year according to the very attractive collective agreement of the metal industry. An overpayment is possible, depending on your qualifications and experience
