title: Junior Business Analyst (Remote Internship)
description:
LOCATION: Remote Work

SCHEDULE: Part-time

Are you eager to hone your business analysis skills and kick-start a thriving career in this vibrant field? Would you like to collaborate with a prestigious Management Consulting company in Germany and gain hands-on experience in evaluating business operations? TalentKompass Deutschland is excited to present the perfect opportunity for you!

We are currently offering a beginner-level internship program tailored for individuals passionate about examining business operations and identifying areas for improvement. This internship will equip you with practical experience in business analysis while enhancing your expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, and more.

As an intern with our client's Management Consulting team, you will work closely with accomplished Business Analysts and consultants to collect and analyze data, discern trends and insights, and formulate recommendations for clients. This remote position allows you to work from... the comfort of your own home.

What we're looking for:
‚Ä¢ A genuine interest in understanding business operations
‚Ä¢ Robust analytical skills and the ability to extract meaningful insights from complex data sets
‚Ä¢ Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with a knack for collaborating with team members at all levels
‚Ä¢ Meticulous attention to detail and the ability to work precisely in a fast-paced environment
‚Ä¢ A commitment to learning and growing in the field of business analysis
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with Microsoft Excel or other data analysis tools
‚Ä¢ A basic understanding of statistical analysis and modeling techniques

Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Assist in collecting and analyzing data from various sources
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with consultants to identify trends and insights
‚Ä¢ Develop recommendations to address business challenges
‚Ä¢ Participate in team meetings, contributing ideas and insights
‚Ä¢ Foster a positive team culture and collaborate to achieve team objectives
‚Ä¢ Support the creation of project documentation

If you're prepared to embark on your business analysis career and acquire practical experience, we encourage you to apply for our internship program. Seize this exciting opportunity to learn and grow in the field of business analysis

What we're looking for:
‚Ä¢ A genuine interest in understanding business operations
‚Ä¢ Robust analytical skills and the ability to extract meaningful insights from complex data sets
‚Ä¢ Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with a knack for collaborating with team members at all levels
‚Ä¢ Meticulous attention to detail and the ability to work precisely in a fast-paced environment
‚Ä¢ A commitment to learning and growing in the field of business analysis
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with Microsoft Excel or other data analysis tools
‚Ä¢ A basic understanding of statistical analysis and modeling techniques

Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Assist in collecting and analyzing data from various sources
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with consultants to identify trends and insights
‚Ä¢ Develop recommendations to address business challenges
‚Ä¢ Participate in team meetings, contributing ideas and insights
‚Ä¢ Foster a positive team culture and collaborate to achieve team objectives
‚Ä¢ Support the creation of project documentation

If you're prepared to embark on your business analysis career and acquire practical experience, we encourage you to apply for our internship program. Seize this exciting opportunity to learn and grow in the field of business analysis"]}]

title: Senior Business Analyst, Intelligent Automation
description:
A new adventure awaits‚Ä¶
At Zurich we‚Äôre on a journey to lighting the way to a brighter future‚Ä¶ a brighter future for you ‚Äì focused on your career, your wellbeing, and your community ‚Äì as well as our customers and the planet.
This exciting adventure will drive positive impact. So, if you want to be part of a values led organisation, that is a leader in the insurance industry with a track record of making a real difference and continuously taking steps toward a sustainable future for our people, customers, communities, and our planet, read on Let‚Äôs create a brighter future together, let‚Äôs make a difference
Work is something you do, not only somewhere you go. The way we work continues to evolve and at Zurich we are committed to creating ways of working that ensure you are helping to create a brighter future.
As the Intelligent Automation Process Designer, you will support the embedment and expansion of the automation program across Zurich Financial Services Australia and New Zealand. You... will leverage business and technical stakeholder relationships to lead the delivery of Intelligent Automation initiatives which achieve customer, time, cost, and benefit outcomes.
In addition, you will provide support and analysis across the portfolio of automated processes to continuously optimise performance and return on investment. Important to your success ‚Äì let‚Äôs grow together
‚Ä¢ Experience in supporting continuous improvement initiatives and designing solutions to solve business problems.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated understanding of Intelligent Automation technologies and operational excellence principles.
‚Ä¢ Financial services (essential) or Insurance experience (preferred).
‚Ä¢ Strong relationship building, problem solving and time management skills.
Belong. Zurich is here to support you
There are many reasons why Zurich is the right choice for you, but here are just a few ‚Äì grow, and thrive in your career (we support and encourage it); work with global, diverse, and inclusive teams; explore your passions, fuel innovation, drive equity, collaborate and make a positive difference beyond your role; access programs to stay healthy and feel healthier; Flexwork@Zurich; become an activist in your community with the support of Z Zurich Foundation; award winning training programs; state-of-the-art Green Star rated office in North Sydney; we plant a tree for every new employee ‚Äì one of many local initiatives driving our contribution to ambitious global sustainability targets.
We could go on, but the main point is that Zurich is a place that you can truly belong and thrive
Zurich is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to ensuring that our recruitment process is fair and accessible for all candidates. If you require any special accommodations to participate in our recruitment process, we encourage you to let us know at the time of your application.
So, if you want to come on an adventure that will build a brighter future together, and feel a sense of togetherness, then please apply today to start your adventure

title: Sr. Analyst, IT Business Systems, EU
description: Group Introduction Transforming mobility. Making automotive technology that is smarter, cleaner, safer and lighter. That‚Äôs what we‚Äôre passionate about at Magna Powertrain, and we do it by creating world-class powertrain systems. We are a premier supplier for the global automotive industry with full capabilities in design, development, testing and manufacturing of complex powertrain systems. Our name stands for quality, environmental consciousness, and safety. Innovation is what drives us and we drive innovation. Dream big and create the future of mobility at Magna Powertrain. Role Summary As Sr. Analyst, IT Business Systems you will be responsible for the project management of IT system implementations, rollouts and integrations (interfaces) in a global system landscape. You support the Sr. Manager, Business Relationship Management for Europe. You will work in cross-functional teams and offer expert advice and assistance in the use of IT systems and applications to all our employees... Your responsibilities Continuous improvement of processes within Magna Powertrain's global system landscape Analyse business demands, create project definitions and financial business plans Support implementation and coordination of our global cross-functional business systems Interact with third parties ensuring procedures detailed in Service Level Agreements are defined and followed Configure and test the application, adjust necessary interfaces between different IT applications Meet business requirements and ensure stakeholders are informed on the impact of potential changes Use reporting tools to create, develop and maintain reports to monitor data quality and support the organization Support the implementation of upgrades, patches and maintenance efforts Your qualification Masters or Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or the equivalent in experience Minimum of 5 years‚Äô experience of performing, supporting business processes within IT-Tools Demonstrate understanding of working in a customer focused environment Demonstrate experience of developing and maintaining procedures appropriate for supporting IT services in a complex environment Experience in organizational projects or know-how in organizational / change management is highly welcomed Excellent communication and presentation skills (additional trainer experience is highly welcomed) ‚Ä¢ Readiness to travel regional in Europe and globally from time to time Experience in global teamwork and different cultures will be an advantage Fluent in German and English Our offer Benefits: As an international company, we offer attractive services such as various sports and health programs, numerous benefits at partner companies and the Magna Profit Sharing Program in addition to exciting tasks, flexible working hours and an extensive range of training and education opportunities (incl. onboarding sessions, individual trainings, mentoring program,‚Ä¶) Salary: For this function, we offer an attractive compensation package that matches your individual experience and qualifications. The gross monthly salary corresponding to the metal collective agreement for 38.5 hours is at least 3.439,42 (14 x p.a.). title: Business Analyst
description:
Job Description

Job Title: Business Analyst

Reports to: Sr Manager, Operations and Development

Group / Division: Service & Support, ANZ

Career Band: Band 5

Job Track: Professional

Position Location: Scoresby, Victoria √Ç √Ç

Number of Direct Reports: 0

Position Summary:

Your role as Business Analyst at Thermo Fisher Scientific is strategic, enabling you to generate actionable business intellegence initiatives through data analysis and modelling to help optimize strategies and drive process improvement within the Service and Support business.√Ç Your role is multidimensional, covering technology, process and data strategies.

You will work closely with the service leaders, operations team and various commercial stakeholders to capture measurement of activities that enable actionable decisions.√Ç If you thrive in a dynamic, fast moving environment with a culture of process improvement, teamwork, and success, then this is the role for you.

How will you make an impact:√Ç

Reporting
‚Ä¢... Collect and prioritize relevant data into practical insights using a variety of data sources, distilling them into impactful reporting, demonstrating powerful data visualization tools.
‚Ä¢ Create dashboards and key reports (PowerBI or other data visualization platform experience a plus).
‚Ä¢ Develop, enhance, and optimize business analytics to deliver critical insights
‚Ä¢ Prepare and present reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate findings, insights, and recommendations.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with subject matter experts to ensure data quality and integrity is maintained during collection and reporting

Analysis and Insights
‚Ä¢ Document and standardise data entry processes for all systems to ensure data integrity for accurate reporting
‚Ä¢ Ensure KPI and metric tracking remains in alignement with various SOPs and Work Instruction
‚Ä¢ Carry out Service Level pricing review and anlysis with the objective of pricing recommendation
‚Ä¢ Analyse trends and offer insights to internal sales teams to develop commercial opportunities
‚Ä¢ Leveraging metrics to enable continuous improvement to achieve and set new performance standards

How will you get there:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor√¢s degree, preferably in finance, business or data analytics or related field, preferable in a service-based industry.
‚Ä¢ 5+ years of confirmed experience in business or data analytics or related field, preferably in a service-based industry
‚Ä¢ Experience with data analysis and visualization tools (e.g. Excel, Tableau, Power BI).
‚Ä¢ Strong proficiency with SQL
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills and is highly inquisitive.
‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:
‚Ä¢ Experience of sophisticated projects; able to effectively prioritize and deal with ambiguity.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated ability to tackle problems and provide internal or external solutions.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of enterprise systems (eg ERP), business intelligence tools (eg SAP business objects), customer relationship management systems (eg SFDC) and service management systems.
‚Ä¢ Collaborative style with ability to work within a matrixed environment and with external customers, influencing outcomes and leading change, both internally and externally.
‚Ä¢ Work autonomously with a bias for action and perseverance.
‚Ä¢ Work simultaneously on multiple requirements with a variety of projects and short timelines.

Frequent Contacts:

Internal
‚Ä¢ Service Business Leaders
‚Ä¢ Information Technology
‚Ä¢ Service operations
‚Ä¢ Service sales

External
‚Ä¢ Customers
‚Ä¢ IT Infrastructure partners

Other Job Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Adhere to OHS policies and procedures and ensure a safe and healthy workplace environment

title: Senior IT Business Analyst for HR Solutions (f/m/div)
description:
Are you a dedicated and solution-oriented professional with a passion for providing exceptional support? As a Senior IT Business Analyst you will play a crucial role in managing our HR systems. This position offers an opportunity to work in a dynamic, international, and multi-cultural environment, collaborating with various stakeholders.

In your new role you will:
‚Ä¢ Be the S ubject Matter Expert for Time Managemen t and the channel between HR business and development teams
‚Ä¢ Support the delivery of the necessary technology services to HR business by analyzing and refining requirements
‚Ä¢ Configure the cloud-based Time Management System UKG Dimensions (Kronos) and provide ongoing support
‚Ä¢ Manage processes to upgrade and maintain UKG Dimension s (Kronos) and work closely together with the vendor
‚Ä¢ Implement end-to-end Time Managemen t processes, incl. technical documentation and training delivery
‚Ä¢ Create the best user experienc e by exploring ease of use approaches to solve end-users... problems

You are best equipped for this task if you have:
‚Ä¢ A degree in Computer Science, Informatics, Business Informatics, or a related field.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of the latest technological trends in the HR IT environment, ideally with experience in SAP HCM and/or UKG Dimensions (Kronos).
‚Ä¢ Experience working with agile methodologies such as Scrum or Kanban would be a plus.
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and presentation skills
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in German and English language

We offer competitive salaries and additional benefits based on your performance, experience and qualification. The employment is in accordance with the collective salary and wage agreement for employees of the electrical and electronics industry, employment group F (https://www.feei.at/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/minimum-salaries-white-collar-workers-2023.pdf). The monthly salary is paid 14 times p.a. We offer a higher compensation depending on your expertise and skills.

More than 5.000 people work at five different sites in Austria.

Driving decarbonization and digitalization. Together.

Infineon designs, develops, manufactures, and markets a broad range of semiconductors and semiconductor-based solutions, focusing on key markets in the automotive, industrial, and consumer sectors. Its products range from standard components to special components for digital, analog, and mixed-signal applications to customer-specific solutions together with the appropriate software.

The Information Technology department has become an important business advisor for Infineon, converting business requirements into great IT solutions. It is responsible for provisioning hardware and software solutions at benchmark costs for all areas within Infineon reaching from office users to research & development, to frontend and backend production around the globe. More than 1000 IT-colleagues work closely together with other business areas and external partners. They increase the efficiency of business processes offering more than just modern equipment, secure infrastructure and newest communication solutions.

The provincial capital Klagenfurt , in the heart of Carinthia, impresses with its liveliness, culture, numerous events and sights. The southern climate with the pictorial W√∂rthersee, the close link between urban infrastructure and rural areas as well as the proximity to Slovenia and Italy make Klagenfurt particularly livable.
https://www.visitklagenfurt.at/en/ .

We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.
This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. At Infineon, we offer a working environment characterized by trust, openness, respect and tolerance and are committed to give all applicants and employees equal opportunities. We base our recruiting decisions on the applicant¬¥s experience and skills.
We look forward to receiving your resume, even if you do not entirely meet all the requirements of the job posting.
Please let your recruiter know if they need to pay special attention to something in order to enable your participation in the interview process.
More about diversity & inclusion at Infineon at https://www.infineon.com/cms/en/careers/diversity-and-inclusion

title: Business Analyst (m/f/d)
description:
We are Rosenberger Telematics. As a family-run company and one of the leading providers of telematics solutions, we specialize in the networking and tracking of machinery & fleets. Whether vehicle, excavator, container, silo or truck, we digitize the world of mobile objects. Our parent organization Rosenberger Hochfrequenztechnik is a hidden champion as a supplier in the automotive as well as telecommunications industry.

Why you should join our team:

We work in a promising & exciting market, with great people on international & diverse projects. In addition, we offer you an open working atmosphere with flat hierarchies and great personal freedom.

Tasks:

‚Äì You are responsible for the elicitation and definition of requirements

‚Äì Translating the business requirements into the technical possibilities

‚Äì You coordinate and control the test activities and the product implementation

‚Äì You take care of the clear communication and the progress of the project

‚Äì You work closely with the... other departments to define the product

‚Äì You are innovative and propose solutions

Qualification:

‚Äì Several years of professional experience as a business analyst or in similar positions

‚Äì Experience in software development

‚Äì Knowledge of IT requirements management and IT project management

‚Äì Experience in external customer contact

‚Äì High degree of independence, strong communication skills and analytical ability

‚Äì Good knowledge in English

4 reasons for Rosenberger Telematics:

‚Äì The perfect company size: we are large enough to be able to implement large and exciting projects, yet small enough to keep hierarchies flat. This makes the interaction among colleagues familiar and the cooperation constructive and efficient.

‚Äì The Team spirit: One of the best things about working at Rosenberger Telematics is our good working atmosphere. This means team cohesion with honest collegiality and appreciation. This culture of cohesion is close to our hearts and we invite you to become a part of it.

‚Äì The Flexibility: First of all, regulated working hours are a matter of course for us. Nevertheless, there is enough room for individual flexibility. That‚Äôs why home office is also possible.

‚Äì The attractive salary: We offer you a very attractive salary above the minimum annual gross salary of 55,000 euros. The actual salary, however, is determined by a classification depending on your education, qualifications and experience.

We are looking forward to your application

title: Junior Business Analyst (Remote Internship)
description:
LOCATION: Remote Work

SCHEDULE: Part-time

Are you eager to hone your business analysis skills and kick-start a thriving career in this vibrant field? Would you like to collaborate with a prestigious Management Consulting company in Germany and gain hands-on experience in evaluating business operations? TalentKompass Deutschland is excited to present the perfect opportunity for you!

We are currently offering a beginner-level internship program tailored for individuals passionate about examining business operations and identifying areas for improvement. This internship will equip you with practical experience in business analysis while enhancing your expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, and more.

As an intern with our client's Management Consulting team, you will work closely with accomplished Business Analysts and consultants to collect and analyze data, discern trends and insights, and formulate recommendations for clients. This remote position allows you to work from... the comfort of your own home.

What we're looking for:
‚Ä¢ A genuine interest in understanding business operations
‚Ä¢ Robust analytical skills and the ability to extract meaningful insights from complex data sets
‚Ä¢ Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with a knack for collaborating with team members at all levels
‚Ä¢ Meticulous attention to detail and the ability to work precisely in a fast-paced environment
‚Ä¢ A commitment to learning and growing in the field of business analysis
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with Microsoft Excel or other data analysis tools
‚Ä¢ A basic understanding of statistical analysis and modeling techniques

Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Assist in collecting and analyzing data from various sources
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with consultants to identify trends and insights
‚Ä¢ Develop recommendations to address business challenges
‚Ä¢ Participate in team meetings, contributing ideas and insights
‚Ä¢ Foster a positive team culture and collaborate to achieve team objectives
‚Ä¢ Support the creation of project documentation

If you're prepared to embark on your business analysis career and acquire practical experience, we encourage you to apply for our internship program. Seize this exciting opportunity to learn and grow in the field of business analysis

title: Financial Planning Process Analyst
description:
To strengthen our international team, we are looking for a Financial Planning Process Analyst with a strong focus on Planning Process & Data Quality in our global headquarter in Fuschl am See. The role is placed within the Finance Function of the Global Data & Analytics Team.

In this challenging position, the key deliverable to the organization is to secure process excellence combined with a high degree of data quality throughout the financial planning process. As part of the Finance Data Quality Management Team, one governs, and quality assures the financial planning process from an end-to-end business perspective. Training & support of the global finance community on the process & system side, as well as ensuring relevant, high-quality go-lives of developments and enhancements complement this profile. Through close collaboration with our internal and external stakeholders & our subsidiaries worldwide, we challenge and push our state-of-the-art planning solution to the next level.

title: BI Developer/Analyst (m/f/x), HR Systems
via: via Jobs At Magna - Magna International
description:
Group Description

At Magna, we create technology that disrupts the industry and solves big problems for consumers, our customers, and the world around us. We‚Äôre the only mobility technology company and supplier with complete expertise across the entire vehicle.

We are committed to quality and continuous improvement because our products impact millions of people every day. But we‚Äôre more than what we make. We are a group of entrepreneurial-minded people whose collective expertise gives us a competitive advantage. World Class Manufacturing is a journey and it‚Äôs our talented people who lead us on this journey.

Role Summary

The Business Intelligence (BI) Developer/Analyst will be responsible for interpreting the business needs of HR stakeholders and for developing the reporting analytics that meet those needs. This includes the design, development, maintenance, integration and reporting of business systems through cubes, ad-hoc reports, and dashboards. The Business Intelligence... Developer/Analyst will work closely and effectively with internal stakeholders and business analysts to provide support and expertise in data management, reporting and underlying infrastructure. This position may also need to cover oversight and guidance on deliverables provided by external partners as well a supervising & leading role in the team.

Key Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Work with the business to define reporting/BI requirements and translate those requirements into reporting/BI deliverables.
‚Ä¢ Design complex business intelligence and analytic solutions based on functional requirements.
‚Ä¢ Translate data results into written reports, tables, graphs, and charts.
‚Ä¢ Ensure the availability and performance of the solutions and reports.
‚Ä¢ Participate in and lead functional and technical specification reviews.
‚Ä¢ Research technical solutions to solve business problems.
‚Ä¢ Develop/train on company standards and procedures to support self-service BI.
‚Ä¢ Provide training and technical assistance to other team members and users for generation of various types of reporting.
‚Ä¢ Provide ongoing support for legacy and future BI solutions.

Work Experience
‚Ä¢ 3 to 5 Years of Work Related Experience.

Knowledge and Education
‚Ä¢ Completion of University Degree in the field of computer science or Information Technology.

Key Qualifications/Requirements
‚Ä¢ Experience in developing reporting or dashboard solutions with BI tools (PowerBI preferred).
‚Ä¢ Experience in creating data models (SSAS Tabular Model preferred).
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in ETL and Data Warehouse concepts.
‚Ä¢ Strong SQL and scripting skills.
‚Ä¢ Advanced skills in Microsoft BI stack (SSAS, Power Pivot, Power View, PowerBI).
‚Ä¢ Self-motivated and self-managed with a high degree of analytical skills (quick comprehension, abstract thinking, recognize relationships).
‚Ä¢ Ability to be a strong team member and communicate effectively.
‚Ä¢ Ability to prioritize and multi-task, and reasonably estimate work effort for tasks.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated critical thinking and analytic skills with strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
‚Ä¢ Ability to manage confidential and sensitive employee information.
‚Ä¢ Ability to accurately collect information to understand and assess the clients‚Äô needs and situation.
‚Ä¢ Understanding of HR operations and processes, and experience in employee data management a nice to have.
‚Ä¢ Excellent English language skills (written and oral).

Additional Information

Salary starting from 45 000 EUR/ gross/year. We offer attractive benefits (expl. profit participation, yearly bonus, development opportunities).

For dedicated and motivated employees, we offer an interesting and diversified job within a dynamic global team together with the individual and functional development in a professional environment of a global acting business. Fair treatment and a sense of responsibility towards employees are the principle of the Magna culture. We strive to offer an inspiring and motivating work environment.

Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.

At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That‚Äôs why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law

title: IT Business Analyst
description:
Our client is an excellently positioned company in the paper and packaging industry with several production sites throughout Europe. The basis for their international success lies in the personal commitment of each and every employee. They offer an interesting environment that promotes self-responsible action, characterized by open communication and teamwork!

As they continue to grow, they are now actively looking for a talented and passionate
IT Business Analyst to join their team.

Your responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Monitor the smooth implementation of SAP processes
‚Ä¢ Develope new business lines to improve existing models in the production and logistics environment
‚Ä¢ Participate in the SAP rollout of production facilities in other locations
‚Ä¢ Define the market and adapt processes to market needs

Your profile:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Informatics, Business Administration, Industrial Engineering or an equivalent valuable training
‚Ä¢ Background as a Business Analyst or other comparable... role
‚Ä¢ Preferably experience with BI tools
‚Ä¢ Independence, creativity and ability of problem-solving
‚Ä¢ Analytical and organizational skills with innovation and great communication abilities
‚Ä¢ High English and German language proficiency

Your benefits:
‚Ä¢ Generous compensation package and favorable working conditions
‚Ä¢ Flexible working hours and home-office options
‚Ä¢ International team with diverse backgrounds, where respect, support and openness are key
‚Ä¢ Stimulating projects and opportunities for personal growth
‚Ä¢ Relocation package with VISA support and company apartments if necessary
‚Ä¢ Being part of a growing company with a focus on sustainability
‚Ä¢ Annual gross salary starting from 70.000‚Ç¨ with possibility of an increased salary depending on professional background. Individual experience and knowledge will be clearly honoured in the reel compensation package If you are interested in this challenging position we are looking forward to receiving your comprehensive application for

title: Maritime Sustainment Model Business Analyst
description:
Title:
Maritime Sustainment Model Business Analyst

Your KBR future - delivering solutions and changing the world

About KBR:

Kellogg Brown & Root (KBR) is a leading Defence and Government professional services provider. In Australia, KBR has been delivering solutions to Defence and Defence industry for over 20 years. We provide in-depth expertise to a wide range of Defence sector projects through our core competencies of program and project management, engineering, asset management, integrated logistics support, procurement and training solutions.

Learn more about our business here.

The opportunity:

Mission and Scope

Department of Defence is undergoing an ambitious but achievable reform program for sustainment of the RAN√¢s surface fleet. Key to the new approach is the Maritime Sustainment Model (MSM) and its use of standardised contracts, plans, processes, guides, procedures, and ICT tools by its workforce and across the Maritime Enterprise. Development of this sovereign... sustainment capability is key to ensuring Defence has the workforce, systems, tools, supply chains and infrastructure to support the future fleet and operations.

As part of the MSM Team, the MSM Business Analyst is accountable to the MSM Lead to develop a suite of processes which enable optimisation of the MSM across the Maritime Sustainment Division Enterprise.

Responsibilities

The key responsibilities of the role will include, but is not limited to:
‚Ä¢ Apply process excellence tools and techniques to understand, analyse, document and recommend future process and solutions in line with NLIS business needs.
‚Ä¢ Facilitate stakeholder engagements via Workshops, Interviews, Focus Groups, and using previously documented materials to establish accurate process workflows.
‚Ä¢ Scope process and analysis appropriately and identify core stakeholders and associated benefits and risks related to Navy and Defence Systems.
‚Ä¢ Recommend effective process strategies to the business problem and or new opportunities within the Maritime Domain.
‚Ä¢ Actively engage with stakeholders to ensure recommended solutions are in line with core business needs.
‚Ä¢ Ensure process strategies are aligned with the long-term business requirements of the systems program offices and Navy Logistics Systems.
‚Ä¢ Enhance business processes to drive Process Maturity through Process Re-Engineering and Continuous Improvement.
‚Ä¢ Document and ensure that processes in Training Services are consistently documented using a practical set of Business Process Model & Notation (BPMN) standards and process modelling tools.
‚Ä¢ Document processes following the team's Process Governance and Architecture practices defining business rules and templates.
‚Ä¢ High Level and Low-Level Design of Process development using Lean Methodology and ensure that documentation of the future state process design adheres to the required governance and architecture practices.
‚Ä¢ Process Development and Delivery of all known application standards used by Navy Logistics Systems.

As the ideal candidate, you will bring:

Qualifications, Skills and Experience:

Essential:
‚Ä¢ Experience in business analysis and operational process design using Holocentric or similar BPMN tools.
‚Ä¢ Ability to assess existing workflows and identify options for improvement.
‚Ä¢ Experience understanding and documenting the impacts of change and adapting to processes, business practices and operational requirements.
‚Ä¢ Experienced in the use of MS Office products, business process tools and complex applications.
‚Ä¢ Experience in creation of flow and logic diagrams.

Desirable:
‚Ä¢ Experience working in a Defence network/systems environment

What we will offer you:
‚Ä¢ A workplace culture certified as a Great Place To Work
‚Ä¢ Flexible working conditions
‚Ä¢ Competitive salary (including annual reviews)
‚Ä¢ Paid parental leave
‚Ä¢ Income protection
‚Ä¢ Corporate rewards
‚Ä¢ Salary packaging/Novated leasing
‚Ä¢ Employee stock purchase plans
‚Ä¢ Flu shots, skin checks and private health insurance
‚Ä¢ Career development: Online learning, mentorship and career pathways

If you√¢re ready to shape tomorrow, let√¢s get started. Apply Now

KBR acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of Country throughout Australia and their continuing connections to land, sea, community and culture. We pay our respects to Elders past and present.

KBR is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an inclusive and diverse work environment. We encourage candidates of all abilities to apply.

As a Major Service Provider of the Australian Defence Force, an AGSVA security clearance will be required and compliance to International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). As such, our hiring decisions are based on the key requirements of each role and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and experiences.

title: Business Process Analyst
description:
Company Description

We are looking for a Business Process Analysis and Improvement specialist to strengthen our Process Excellence team at the global Red Bull headquarters in Salzburg, Austria.

In this position, you'll support the business as process analysis expert to drive process optimization utilizing process data analyses based on state-of-the-art process mining technologies. You'll collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand the business requirements, combine data from different source systems, define data requirements, analyze information and identify and drive process improvements. You'll act as a coach for the business regarding improvement of the business processes.

Job Description

BUSINESS PROCESSES & NEEDS

You'll review business requests, define data requirements, system connections, and performance indicators to deliver process mining dashboards and solutions to the business.

PROCESS ANALYSIS

You'll work with the business to measure and... analyse business processes to understand strengths and improvements and their associated root causes.

VALUE REALIZATION

You'll deliver process mining solutions to the business and monitor the value and resolution of process optimizations and the wider process mining program.

ROLLOUT & TRAINING

You'll analyse use cases for global applicability and train end users to use process mining to find improvements and drive value realization. Finally, you'll develop and maintain process mining methodologies, standards and templates to ensure a streamlined engagement with the business.

Qualifications

4-6 years relevant work experience in process management, process improvement and data analysis

Proven experience driving process improvement, preferably through methodologies such as Six Sigma, Lean, Kaizen

Strong analytical and numerical skills, including the ability to think differently about the data, which may lead to less obvious conclusions

High affinity to IT systems especially strong familiarity with business process software and process mining tools (Celonis)

End user knowledge for ERP systems like SAP, Business Objects, BI is an advantage

Strong communication skills, particularly the ability to convey complex topics in simple memorable terms

Willingness to learn, to accept challenges and work in a team environment

Result and performance oriented

Additional Information

#E

University Degree; Or Equivalent Professional Experience

#L

Fluent in English

#K

Analyst, Celonis, Process Improvement, Process Mining, process management, Prozessmanagement, Prozesse, Six Sigma, Data Analysis

#D

Aus gesetzlichen Gr√ºnden sind wir verpflichtet darauf hinzuweisen, dass das kollektivvertragliche Mindestgehalt f√ºr diese Position bei monatlich EUR 2.181 brutto liegt. Unsere attraktiven Gehaltspakete orientieren sich jedoch an aktuellen Marktgeh√§ltern und liegen daher deutlich √ºber dem angegebenen Mindestgehalt.

As an employer, we value diversity and support people in developing their potential and strengths, realizing their ideas and seizing opportunities. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, skin colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation or origin

title: SAP Solution Analyst (m/f/d) Production
description:
SAP Solution Analyst (m/f/d) Production

We get the world's most exciting powersports vehicles moving. As part of BRP, with around 20,000 employees worldwide, we are driven by technological progress and sustainable mobility. And what does your heart beat for?

Your new adventure

As SAP Solution Analyst Production you will be responsible and active for all technical aspects of the software lifecycle (conception, customizing, development, testing, documentation and 3rd level support) in a modern system landscape (SAP Quality Award in Gold) and in an international team.
‚Ä¢ Together with the local and global IT team, you will drive the further development of existing applications and the preparation for S/4 HANA throughout the company.
‚Ä¢ Home office! Both virtually and personally, you will be in close exchange with the specialist department (flexible home office incl. home office flat rate).
‚Ä¢ You will think outside the box and work closely with the internal business analyst team and the... solution architect to translate business requirements into a functional design.
‚Ä¢ You can expect a company with a wide range of production: industrialization of new products (e.g. electric motors), mechanical manufacturing as well as fully automated assembly.

Your experiences and skills
‚Ä¢ Completed studies (FH, university) in the fields of information technology or applied computer science
‚Ä¢ At least 3 years of professional experience in a comparable IS&T role and industry
‚Ä¢ Very good SAP knowledge (PP, MM, QM, WM) as well as basic knowledge of IS&T infrastructure and system architecture
‚Ä¢ English language skills, German knowledge is an advantage
‚Ä¢ Problem-solving team player with a high level of personal responsibility, commitment and analytical thinking

We offer
You will receive an exciting position in an international company with many interesting benefits. The minimum salary for this position is ‚Ç¨ 53.068,12 EUR gross/year according to the very attractive collective agreement of the metal industry. An overpayment is possible, depending on your qualifications and experience

title: SAP Business Analyst / I2D (Remote, Zurich Based, Permanent Contract)
description:
Position: SAP Business Analyst / I2D Invest to Divest - Focus Investments management

Location: Remote with travel to Zurich, Switzerland

Contract: Permanent contract

Salary: 80‚Ç¨ - 95‚Ç¨ per hour

This is a remote position and we welcome applications from within the EU.

Who you will be working for:

Our client is a major international IT consulting company within the Fortune 50. You‚Äôll work with visionaries across multiple industries for the world's most innovative and valuable companies.

Your Role and Responsibilities

As an SAP Business Analyst I2D, Invest to Divest (investment management and fixed asset accounting) in a large S/4HANA transformation program, you will serve as a client-facing practitioner who leads and implements expert services utilizing the breadth of our offerings and technologies. A successful Consultant is regarded by clients as a trusted business advisor who collaborates to provide innovative solutions used to solve the most challenging business problems.

As... a Business Analyst on our SAP S/4 HANA program:
‚Ä¢ You will identify process improvements and outline design proposals in terms of best practice/best-fit solutions in the S/4HANA but also in the context of interfaces to/with surrounding systems.
‚Ä¢ You structure and moderate discussions about business requirements with business departments and with external stakeholders in the relevant business area.
‚Ä¢ You work closely with agile teams that are responsible for implementation (i.e. SAP consultants and developers as well as business functional product owners) to understand functionalities, issues and optimization opportunities well
‚Ä¢ You evaluate options in terms of feasibility, potential and effort

Your tasks will include:
‚Ä¢ The structured management and moderation of workshops with representatives - including the preparation and follow-up of the
results
‚Ä¢ Gathering requirements and insights for complex business processes to support the solution design process guiding and supporting other stakeholders in analysis, design and further development of solution proposals
‚Ä¢ Create structured and complete documentation (concept documents, business blueprints, technical specification of WRICEF documents)

You bring the following skills with you:
‚Ä¢ Profound SAP design and implementation experience in I2D Invest to Divest
‚Ä¢ No programming knowledge required
‚Ä¢ Focus Investments management
‚Ä¢ Solid and practical, perennial technical and process knowledge
‚Ä¢ A structured and pragmatic approach
‚Ä¢ Ability to make complex issues simple and understandable in one structured form and explain them in an understandable way

This is a remote position and we welcome applications from within the EU.

Sounds interesting? Please send us your CV or LinkedIn profile outlining a track record of your achievements. In case of any questions, please contact E-Mail auf click.appcast.io ansehen

We are looking forward to hearing from you!

By replying to this job offer, you agree with processing your personal information and confirm that you have had the opportunity to learn about our handling of your personal data.

Guaranteed reply to all applicants

title: Analyst, IT Business Systems (m/f/x)
description:
Job Number : 58449

Group : Magna Powertrain

Division : Sankt Valentin

Job Type : Permanent / Regular

Location : ST. VALENTIN, BELGRADE, LANNACH

Group Introduction

Advancing mobility. Making automotive technology that is smarter, cleaner, and safer, while still fun to drive. And making it for everyone.

That‚Äôs what we‚Äôre passionate about at Magna Powertrain. We do it by creating world-class powertrain solutions for conventional, hybrid, and pure electric vehicles.

We‚Äôre making electrification more than a buzzword, we‚Äôre bringing it to the road. Innovation is what drives us and we drive innovation.

Dream big and create the future of mobility at Magna Powertrain.

What can you expect

You will administer the Magna Powertrain PlanviewOne IT system, which is used globally by all MAGNA locations. As a specialist for IT applications you are responsible for system stability, performance and data integrity.

You are part of an international team and assume responsibility for the... following tasks within the team :
‚Ä¢ Configuration, customizing and testing of user stories in PlanviewOne.
‚Ä¢ You act as a technical contact for the software manufacturer and other partner companies.
‚Ä¢ Administration of the PlanviewOne system architecture and the associated continuous improvement of usability, functionality and performance.
‚Ä¢ Ensuring IT service quality, security and compliance requirements and implementation / adaptation of the authorization concept.
‚Ä¢ Support of the project team with technical know-how in the IT environment and interface to internal departments.

Key Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Technical college or bachelor's degree in IT or computer science
‚Ä¢ Ideally 2-3 years of professional experience with IT applications
‚Ä¢ Experience in dealing with agile development, data management via SQL and PowerBi reports
‚Ä¢ Reliable and independent way of working
‚Ä¢ Communication and presentation skills in English, German beneficial

What we offer

We have flat hierarchies and after a structured onboarding there will be exciting tasks and new challenges waiting for you in a dynamic and motivated surrounding.

The position can be fullfilled in Lannach, Traiskirchen or St. Valentin (Austria), Untergruppenbach (Germany) or in Serbia.

Benefits

As an international company, we offer attractive services such as various sports and health programs, numerous benefits at partner companies and the Magna Profit Sharing Program in addition to exciting tasks, flexible working hours and an extensive range of training and education opportunities.

Compensation

Commitment and qualification pay off at MAGNA Powertrain : For this position we offer an annual gross starting salary from ‚Ç¨42,000 on a full-time basis.

However, the actual salary will be determined together with you on the basis of previous service, qualifications, relevant professional experience and the collective agreement of the vehicle industry

title: IT Business Analyst
description:
IT Business Analyst (m/f/d) Production

We get the world's most exciting powersports vehicles moving. As part of BRP, with around 20,000 employees worldwide, we are driven by technological progress and sustainable mobility. And what does your heart beat for?

Your new adventure
‚Ä¢ Main contact for all IS&T relevant topics in production (manufacturing & assembly)
‚Ä¢ Responsible for the definition of the annual roadmap as well as the implementation of the IS&T portfolio
‚Ä¢ Budget responsibility as well as preparation of budget and project proposals
‚Ä¢ Close cooperation with the business department and the solution analyst
‚Ä¢ Contact person for support requests in the application (ERP & MES)
‚Ä¢ Administrative project-related tasks (coordination and scheduling of meetings)

Your experiences and skills
‚Ä¢ Completed adequate IT studies (university, FH) with at least 3 years of professional experience
‚Ä¢ Technical knowledge in ERP and MES systems
‚Ä¢ Business knowledge and process knowledge in an... industrial environment
‚Ä¢ Understanding and experience of production processes
‚Ä¢ Very good knowledge of German and English
‚Ä¢ Strong communication skills and analytical thinking and acting

We offer

You will receive an exciting position in an international company with many interesting benefits. The minimum salary for this position is EUR 53.068,12 gross/year in accordance with the very attractive collective agreement for the metal industry. An overpayment is possible, depending on your qualifications and experience
